title: Woman, 35, says best thing about marriage to first cousin, 55, is no in-laws
text:
35 year-old digital artist Erin says she can’t wait to marry her first cousin Richard next year – and says the two share a connection she is convinced comes from their close genetic bond (Pictures: Metro US)

A 35 year-old woman says the best thing about being engaged to her 55 year-old first cousin is not having to worry about in-laws

The bride-to-be, who wants only to be known as Erin, revealed an unusual benefit of marrying close relative Richard, and said he is the most considerate partner she has ever had.

Erin, whose father was Richard’s mother’s brother, is going to marry her fiance near their home in Colorado next August.

The digital artist moved in with Richard, in Autumn 2018 after her first marriage ended in 2017, with the couple getting engaged earlier this year.

Erin’s home state is one of the few in the United States where marriages between first cousins are legal.

Erin says she first moved in with Richard because she needed a place to stay after her marriage ended, but was surprised when she ended up falling in love with him (Picture: Metro US)

The mother, who has an eight year-old daughter from a previous relationship, is also trying to a baby with construction worker Richard, despite warnings that babies born to close relatives are at higher risk of genetic abnormalities.

Erin told Metro US: ‘This is by far the most fulfilling relationship I’ve ever been in, the most loving partner I’ve ever had.

‘And of course your own family isn’t going to treat you badly, so I see a lot of benefits in these kinds of relationships.

‘I’m respected, I’m loved and cherished. I’m spoiled – I get everything I want, anytime I want it.

‘I don’t have to worry about having issues with in-laws, as all my in laws are my blood family.’

Erin will wed Richard next year in their home state of Colorado. It is one of the few states in the US where marriages between first cousins are legal (Picture: Metro US)

Erin, who is originally from California, said Richard first contacted her on Facebook in 2017 and began flirting – but that she was unnerved by his attention, and blocked him.

She explained: ‘He was flirting with me on Facebook, he expressed to me that he found me attractive, and that he hoped that didn’t make me uncomfortable.

‘I recall enjoying the attention and going on with it for a bit.

‘But then it started to make me really uncomfortable and nervous because things got really intimate and sexual, so i just stopped talking to him for a few years, and even blocked him on Facebook.’

She restarted contacted after her marriage began to fail later the same year, and says that initially she only wanted help with a place to stay.

But romance blossomed between the two, with Erin now devoted to her fiance.

She said: ‘I decided to come and stay with him and I guess that’s how I got into this relationship.

‘Yes, it was for financial reasons at first, but I’m in love now and I’ve never had anybody treat me as well as he does.

Erin revealed her hopes to have a child with Richard, saying: ‘We are actively working on conceiving an offspring.’

Asked whether she is concerned that their child could be at higher risk of being born disabled, she added: ‘We haven’t (researched that) but we’re not really worried about it.’

Erin says her friends are liberal and accepting of her relationship.

She says some of her relatives have taken a dimmer view of her romance.

But Erin, who is a survivor of an abusive childhood, is convinced Richard is the life partner for her.

She explained: ‘This cousin in particular takes after me a lot. Our personality traits are almost identical and it makes things extremely easy.

‘It’s really like looking into a mirror and dating myself

‘Getting along is a breeze. I know him without even having to know him.

‘I didn’t grow up with him, its like our history is the same, everybody we know is the same.

‘We’re connected. We don’t have to start from ground zero and work up like other relationships, we already have a bond there, a history there.

‘It’s much easier than normal relationships’
description: Digital artist Erin highlighted an unusual benefit to marrying first-cousin Richard, who she is set to wed next year. The couple are also trying for a baby together
